definitions.example: Waiter, please bring me a single malt whiskey.
The new company director brought a fresh perspective on sales and marketing.
The controversial TV broadcast brought a storm of complaints.

definitions.definition: To raise (a lawsuit, charges, etc.) against somebody.
To persuade; to induce; to draw; to lead; to guide.
To produce in exchange; to sell for; to fetch.
definitions.example: What does coal bring per ton?

definitions.definition: To pitch, often referring to a particularly hard thrown fastball.
definitions.example: The closer Jones can really bring it.

definitions.definition: The act by which something is brought.
